item.title: Covid in Scotland: No change to rules despite rise in cases
item.description: The first minister is not expected to remove any remaining mitigations, including face coverings, at her latest update.

item.title: Fire crews tackle large blaze on Edinburgh's George IV Bridge
item.description: Police are urging people to avoid the area around George IV Bridge where several roads are closed.

item.title: All hospital car parking charges in Scotland to be scrapped
item.description: The Scottish government has struck deals worth £35m to buy out the car parks at Ninewells Hospital and Glasgow Royal Infirmary.

item.title: Billy Connolly: Challenges of Parkinson's getting worse
item.description: The 78-year-old has retired from live performances and says that making TV programmes is getting more challenging.

item.title: Scottish Shop staff urged to report abuse under new law
item.description: A new act protecting workers comes into force as a survey details staff attacks and abuse in the past year.

item.title: Second man, 77, dies after Peterhead scaffolding accident
item.description: Emergency services were called to the scene in Peterhead after the men fell last Wednesday.

item.title: Scotland's papers: Afghanistan airlift and Black Watch soldiers move in
item.description: The ongoing evacuation of Kabul makes the front pages of Scotland's papers as the withdrawal deadline nears.

item.title: McDonald's runs out of milkshakes in England, Scotland and Wales
item.description: Outlets in England, Wales and Scotland hit by supply problems caused by a widespread shortage of lorry drivers.

item.title: Gateshead vet appointed Church of Scotland's first veterinary minister
item.description: The Rev Allan Wright, who runs a practice in Gateshead, will provide a "supportive ear" for vets.

item.title: Kyogo Furuhashi: Rangers bans fans over racial abuse of Celtic star
item.description: The club says it has identified those shown chanting a racist song about Japanese forward Kyogo Furuhashi.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Almost 40% of 16 and 17-year-olds receive vaccine
item.description: The Scottish government hopes to have offered everyone in the age group a first dose by late September.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: How have the rules changed?
item.description: Scotland's levels system of restrictions have come to an end - but what does that mean people can do?

item.title: Covid: Is Scotland lagging behind on vaccine certificates?
item.description: A digital "passport" has been rolled out across the EU - so why does Scotland use a paper system?

item.title: Is the coronavirus pandemic over at last?
item.description: As Scotland loosens most of its remaining restrictions, is the devastating pandemic finally at an end?

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Your questions answered on life after level zero
item.description: Readers have been sending in their questions about what the ending of more Covid rules means for them.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Are young people slowing the vaccine drive?
item.description: Concerns have been raised about vaccine uptake among younger adults, but are they less likely to want a jab? Here, we examine the statistics.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Floating Head sculpture returns to the Clyde after 33 years
item.description: The 27-tonne artwork was originally designed by Richard Groom for the Glasgow Garden Exhibition in 1988.

item.title: The Last Bus: Timothy Spall film gives teen busker big break
item.description: Caitlin Agnew was just 16 when two of her songs were picked to feature on the soundtrack for The Last Bus.

item.title: Slides of Charles Rennie Mackintosh masterpiece found on eBay
item.description: The images of Hill House in Helensburgh, taken in the 1970s by a US architect, were sold for £30.

item.title: In Pictures: Cyclists return for long-distance Loch Ness race
item.description: The 66-mile race was the first cycle sportive event to take place in Scotland since the easing of Covid restrictions.

item.title: Why do I need more smoke alarms in my house?
item.description: Legislation is being introduced that requires all homes to have interlinked smoke alarms fitted.

item.title: SNP and Greens seal power-sharing deal
item.description: The SNP and the Scottish Greens set out their power-sharing deal for Holyrood.

item.title: Film buff rescues more than 20,000 VHS tapes set for dump
item.description: A video shop owner travelled from Liverpool to Dundee to pick up the massive haul from a collector.

item.title: Firefighters tackle early morning blaze in Glasgow city centre
item.description: The Scottish Fire and Rescue Service said that around 45 firefighters were sent to the scene on Wednesday morning.

item.title: Mum of Scots soldier on trauma of Taliban resurgence

item.title: Afghanistan: ‘My family are trapped in the middle of a war’
item.description: Former refugee Abdul Bostani, who fled the Taliban, speaks of his fears for his family in Afghanistan.

item.title: World Cup 2022: How far are Scotland from qualifying for Qatar?
item.description: As Scotland prepare to resume World Cup qualifying next month, how are their prospects of making it to Qatar 2022?

item.title: Scottish Gossip: Patterson, Liverpool, Everton, Samuels, Aberdeen, Smith
item.description: Liverpool could rival Everton in pursuit of Rangers defender as Aberdeen close in on striker.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: A 'different' Games but Paralympians still hope to shine
item.description: The opening ceremony of the Tokyo Paralympics takes place on Tuesday with the Japanese capital still facing Covid-19 challenges.

item.title: Ryan Gauld: Ex-Dundee United youngster talks move to Vancouver, Euro 2020 omission & having no regrets
item.description: After a summer transfer to Vancouver Whitecaps, Dundee United academy product Ryan Gauld discusses his move to the MLS, future Scotland hopes and having no regrets about going abroad as a teenager.

item.title: Aileen Campbell: Time to 'awaken women to football', says new Scottish Women's Football CEO
item.description: Aileen Campbell wants to "awaken the opportunity for women" to take up football after being discouraged from playing as a child.
